intro: Oxydectes sparsiflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered daisy, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow flowers surrounded by white ray florets, which are typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded woodland areas. Oxydectes sparsiflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
